Answer: Thanks for the A2A.I’m going to be blunt and not the most aspirational answer here. Sue me.The use of technology in recruitment is to minimise a recruiter’s admin responsibilities so we can focus on our primary purpose: Hiring the best people for the roles we are handling and using our best judgment to make that happen as fast as possible…A lot of people forget that.AI, Bots, ML, all runs through vast numbers of applicants to work out who is worth us screening manually vs. not worth us looking at applicant’s CV. Sadly for the paddlers of this quick fix, there’s easier ways to reduce excess, exThanks for the A2A.I’m going to be blunt and not the most aspirational answer here. Sue me.The use of technology in recruitment is to minimise a recruiter’s admin responsibilities so we can focus on our primary purpose: Hiring the best people for the roles we are handling and using our best judgment to make that happen as fast as possible…A lot of people forget that.AI, Bots, ML, all runs through vast numbers of applicants to work out who is worth us screening manually vs. not worth us looking at applicant’s CV. Sadly for the paddlers of this quick fix, there’s easier ways to reduce excess, extraneous applicants: Add another step that actually requires more than a click to apply. The biggest problem we have as recruiters: ApathyApathy means that candidates will click with their carefully structured cover letter, their CV that “helpful” websites tell them are optimised for Applicant Tracking Systems” and then move to the next advert.We then have hundreds of applications to review before we can narrow down a list to call. In most cases.To be honest, I’d rather technology step back out of this very human process. We are humans selecting humans based on their capability to be successful in a role. Technology has enabled volumes of applications formerly unheard of and is now offering a technology solution to solving that problem.In some roles, I’ve stopped advertising and just network and headhunt, it’s much easier. I TALK to people. In person.The best and most interesting technology? Do not disturb. I’m working./Rant

Answer: If anything tanks are becoming less effective as technology progresses. Advances in technology are aiding the development of tanks’ main adversary: anti-tank guided missiles. As computing technology progresses, anti-tank missiles get better and better, making tanks more and more vulnerable. Relatively new technologies like thermal sights and fire control computers have made tanks more accurate over the past few decades. However, as a whole tanks are less effective today than they were 20 or 30 years ago, because they are less survivable on the modern battlefield.If anything tanks are becoming less effective as technology progresses. Answer: The way to master digital marketing starts with mastering audience psychology. That means knowing who you're marketing to, what they want, what they currently have, and how your product fits in.Once you understand that you need to know your audience, you need to consider how you can get to know it. There are plenty of professional tools available, but good old-fashioned research still does the trick. A simple excel sheet with desirable traits, demographics, etc, can provide the basis for you to start going more in-depth, talking to potential targets, and defining your audience more sharply.TheThe way to master digital marketing starts with mastering audience psychology. That means knowing who you're marketing to, what they want, what they currently have, and how your product fits in.Once you understand that you need to know your audience, you need to consider how you can get to know it. There are plenty of professional tools available, but good old-fashioned research still does the trick. A simple excel sheet with desirable traits, demographics, etc, can provide the basis for you to start going more in-depth, talking to potential targets, and defining your audience more sharply.The next step is to figure out how to reach your audience. You choose based on the behavior of your audience and the nature of the product/business you're promoting. You wouldn't want to advertise diamond rings in a Youtube ad at the beginning of a documentary about blood diamonds. The algorithm might put you precisely there but the reason you have a job is because you're smarter than algorithms. There are several channels to consider, each with its onw set of challenges.First up is SEO. SEO is a never-ending source of frustration for digital marketers and, simultaneously, the love of our lives. SEO can make you feel like Sisyphus pushing that boulder up a hill or it can make you like Zeus raining lightning from Mount Olympus. Good SEO means organic traffic and organic traffic means revenue with no spending which is always great. Assuming your website is monetized - but that's a different story.The second thing you need to master are ads. Ads have been the very basis of marketing since the advent of marketing. Ad targeting, ad placement, even ad design, must be in your arsenal as a digital marketer.The next thing to master is social media. To a digital marketer, social media isn't just another place to upload ads. It's an invaluable opportunity to gather feedback, interact with the audience, and fine-tune your presence. You might even win some long-term contracts if you play your cards right.Last but not least, always remember that your target audience is not a monolith. Every person has their own quirks and desires and passions and you can't 100% match all of them. Your goal is to connect to that one part of them that can improve itself by investing in whatever you're selling.Answered with the help of:

Answer: You did not specifyCertainly, fossil sunlight is approaching limits faster than truly sustainable energy is making up for the inevitable decline.We just drove across Iowa on US-20. We drove through massive wind farms, with many hundreds of wind turbines spinning.We also counted a total of 87 huge semi tractors and huge, over-length trailers, with many extra wheels, and a “OVERSIZE LOAD” pilot vehicle, fore and aft. They were carrying 10 metre (90′) turbine blades, generator nacelles, huge 10′ diameter vertical tower sections (no more than 1/3rd of a tower per truckload) — as weYou did not specifyCertainly, fossil sunlight is approaching limits faster than truly sustainable energy is making up for the inevitable decline.We just drove across Iowa on US-20. We drove through massive wind farms, with many hundreds of wind turbines spinning.We also counted a total of 87 huge semi tractors and huge, over-length trailers, with many extra wheels, and a “OVERSIZE LOAD” pilot vehicle, fore and aft. They were carrying 10 metre (90′) turbine blades, generator nacelles, huge 10′ diameter vertical tower sections (no more than 1/3rd of a tower per truckload) — as well as cut-up old/damaged turbine blades and towers. All of these vehicles were burning diesel. None of them were electric-powered, and electricity is the energy produced from wind turbines.There is not a single solar-powered solar panel factory in existence. There is not a single wind-powered wind turbine factory in existence.Mind you, I am not against solar power. I am not against wind power. What IThen there’s things like ethanol, which researchers like Thad Patzek have demonstrated actually use more fossil fuel than the energy they produce. Each time you buy gasoline from a pump that says “contains 10% ethanol,” you are buying a farming subsidy,So, don’t worry about technological limits — given infinite energy, technology could continue increasing forever!Rather, recognize (as documented by Howard Odum) that technological improvements cannot continue without more energy.Energy is the “master resource,” and it is balanced on the knife-edge of permanent, irrevocable decline. Get ready to return to 1950s technology — best case! — as fossil sunlight enters its permanent, irrevocable decline.
